content.question: Two large containers, X and Y, contain many colored beads. From a random sample of beads taken from container X, the proportion of blue beads in the sample was recorded as <math alttext="p hat sub X equals 0.35" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.35</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. From a random sample of beads taken from container Y, the proportion of blue beads in the sample was recorded as <math alttext="p hat sub Y equals 0.39" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.39</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Assuming all conditions for inference are met, which of the following procedures is the most appropriate for estimating the difference between the proportions of all blue beads in the containers?

choices.label: A two-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a difference in population proportions
A two-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a difference in sample proportions
A one-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a population proportion
A one-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a sample proportion
A one-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a difference in population proportions

content.answer: A two-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-interval for a difference in population proportions

topic.text: 6.8: Confidence Intervals for the Difference of Two Proportions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate inference method for confidence intervals.
